nodes.text: I don't think this is analogous at all to what I'm saying.
life-permitting universes are vastly improbable compared to the whole array of possible universes and this does cry out for an explanation.
God is the best explanation of the universe
Look it's improbable that anybody would win a lottery but somebody has to win.  The analogy is that any universe is improbable but there has to be some universe
In the case of the universe as opposed to the lottery the outcome is specified and that's what makes the difference.
If the argument does not satisfy the necessary conditions it is not valid
